intro: Gomesa forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' gomesa, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers bloom in shades of white and yellow, adding a delicate beauty to its alpine habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
